org.bytedeco.ale

Class OSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bytedeco.javacpp.Pointer
      • org.bytedeco.ale.OSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    @NoOffset
 @Properties(inherit=ale.class)
public class OSystem
extends Pointer
    This class provides an interface for accessing operating system specific functions. It also comprises an overall parent object, to which all the other objects belong.

    Version:
    $Id: OSystem.hxx,v 1.55 2007/08/12 23:05:12 stephena Exp $
    Author:
    Stephen Anthony

      • setFramerate

        public void setFramerate(@Cast(value="uInt32")
                         int framerate)
        Set the framerate for the video system. It's placed in this class since the mainLoop() method is defined here.

        Parameters:
        framerate - The video framerate to use

public boolean createConsole(@StdString
                                                 BytePointer romfile)
        Creates a new game console from the specified romfile.

        Parameters:
        romfile - The full pathname of the ROM to use
        Returns:
        True on successful creation, otherwise false

      • deleteConsole

        public void deleteConsole()
        Deletes the currently defined console, if it exists. Also prints some statistics (fps, total frames, etc).

      • getROMInfo

        @StdString
public BytePointer getROMInfo(@StdString
                                         BytePointer romfile)
        Gets all possible info about the ROM by creating a temporary Console object and querying it.

        Parameters:
        romfile - The full pathname of the ROM to use
        Returns:
        Some information about this ROM

      • openROM

        @Cast(value="bool")
public boolean openROM(@StdString
                                           BytePointer rom,
                                           @StdString @ByRef
                                           BytePointer md5,
                                           @Cast(value="uInt8**")
                                           PointerPointer image,
                                           IntPointer size)
        Open the given ROM and return an array containing its contents.

        Parameters:
        rom - The absolute pathname of the ROM file
        md5 - The md5 calculated from the ROM file
        image - A pointer to store the ROM data Note, the calling method is responsible for deleting this
        size - The amount of data read into the image array
        Returns:
        False on any errors, else true

      • openROM

                                           BytePointer rom,
                                           @StdString @ByRef
                                           BytePointer md5,
                                           @Cast(value="uInt8**") @ByPtrPtr
                                           BytePointer image,
                                           IntPointer size)
